Dr Peter de Bolla
This class will meet on alternate Wednesdays at 2pm in the Faculty building, starting on October 11. Each session will be &lsquo
column3: by three members of the group who will have the responsibility of organising the format of the class.

column1: The reading for each session is divided between what will be mandatory &ndash
column3: and what can usefully be read to supplement this core. You should ensure that you have read everything on the core list and you should try to read in at least three of the suggested further readings.

column1: On alternate Wednesdays we will meet as a group at 6.00pm in my room in King&rsquo
column2: s, E5 for an hour (t.b.c.). This hour will be used in a variety of ways to introduce the group to a range of cultural materials from the period. There will be no reading required for these sessions but attendance is mandatory. The first will be on October 18.

column1: A long bibilography of works pertaining to the topic is appended to this course description. You should not feel overwhelmed by it, nor attempt to read your way through it &ndash
column2: its purpose is to guide your further reading and curiosity and as such it is offered merely as a set of possible routes through a very much larger body of materials.

column4: and the Birth of Polite Culture
